resource.chars:
the line of Loch Tay, Loch Dochart & the upper <s>branch<\s> reach
of Loch Fyne; Strath Spey from Laggan downwards;
the valley of the Findhorn; & <s>[text?]<\s> the Great Glen;
all of which occupy lines <s>where<\s> intermediate
between the centre & the boundary of their respective areas.
These great valleys are not cracks analogous to
the so-called valleys of elevation of the stratified
districts: they seem to be lines of less elevation
left at the original upheaval of <s>great<\s> the areas
<s>of elevation,<\s> & due to some unequal operation
of the upheaving force. The annexed diagram
shows <s>the [text?]<\s> a frequent form of outline of the country
included in each arch of the foliation; but there
are also several cases where there is a valley
on only one side of the central axis without any
corresponding depression on the other side. 
Perhaps the most striking <s>proof<\s> evidence of the connection
of the physical geography with the foliation
of the rocks, will be found in observing on the
map how many of
the valleys & lakes of the
Highlands follow lines which if produced would
converge on the North of Ireland, near the points of convergence
of the perpendiculars already described.
